application.name: tgocassismos
application.brief: Produce an output mosaic of TGO CaSSIS images from the same observation and filter.

description.p:
If the final product wil not be an RDR, mapmos or automos can be used to produce a mosaic. This program produces a mosaic and adds keywords to the label group "Mosaic".
The input cubes to this program must be from the same observation, same filter, and map projected.
A new label group, required by tgocassisrdrgen, called "Mosaic" is added to the image labels of the output cube. The original label blob is also propagated from the first file in the input list.
This application will produce two cubes. The first cube (that you set with the "TO" parameter) will be your mosaic. A tracking cube will also be created at the same level with tracking information for the original cubes (that you set with the "FROMLIST" parameter). This cube will have the same base name as the mosaic, but will end in "_tracking.cub".

processing sequence for single filter products that will become RDRs
cam2map - project the cube.
tgocassismos - mosaic files and add keywords to the mosaic group.
tgocassisrdrgen - produce a RDR product.

history.change: Added SpacecraftName and InstrumentId to mosaic group.
Update to read the ObservationId from the Archive Group.
Added option to allow user to choose ground range.
Added the "tracking=true" parameter to tgocassismos' call to automos resulting in automatic tracking cube creation.
Added the StopTime keyword to the output Mosaic PVL group, as stop_date_time is required for PDS4 export.

parameter.name: FROMLIST
parameter.description: A single colume list of TGO CaSSIS files that will be mosaiced together. The input files must be from the some observation and be from the same filter. The files must also be map projected.

parameter.name: TO
parameter.description: The output mosaic cube with the new mosaic label group added.

parameter.name: PRIORITY
parameter.description: This parameter is used to select one of two ways to masaic the pixels in areas of overlap.

option.brief: Input cube will be placed on top of the mosaic
option.description: When the input pixel is not Null, the input pixel value will be written to the output cube.

option.brief: Input cube will be placed beneath the mosaic
option.description: When the mosaic pixel is not Null it will be left unchanged.

parameter.name: GRANGE
parameter.description: AUTO is the default for this parameter. By default the ground range is calculated automatically based on the list of input cubes. The user can override this default. If the USER option is selected, values must be entered for the MINLAT, MAXLAT, MINLON, and MAXLON parameters.

option.description: The program will automatically calculate the ground range for the mosaic by examining that latitude and longitude range of all the cubes contained in the list passed to FROMLIST. This is the default option.
The program will apply the ground range values you entered for the mosaic.

parameter.name: MINLAT
parameter.description: The minimum latitude value boundary extent for the output mosaic.

helper.name: H1
helper.description: This button will calculate the latitude and longitude range using the files in the FROMLIST.

parameter.name: MAXLAT
parameter.description: The maximum latitude value boundary extent for the output mosaic.

parameter.name: MINLON
parameter.description: The minimum longitude value boundary extent for the output mosaic.

parameter.name: MAXLON
parameter.description: The maximum longitude value bounary extent for the output mosaic.
